subject: Home & DIY
title: Zaha Hadid's Impossible Curves
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Zaha Hadid's Impossible Curves.

hook.text: Zaha Hadid designed buildings with no straight lines. Critics said her sketches were unbuildable. She built them anyway.

buildup.text: For years Hadid won competitions but nothing got constructed. She was called a 'paper architect' by rivals.

discovery.text: Computer-aided design and parametric modeling finally let factories fabricate the complex curved panels she envisioned.

twist.text: Her MAXXI museum in Rome and the Heydar Aliyev Center in Baku proved flowing forms could actually stand up.

climax.text: In 2004, Hadid became the first woman to win the Pritzker Prizeâ€”architecture's highest honor.

punchline.text: Technology caught up with her imagination.

quiz.question: What technology made Zaha Hadid's curved designs buildable?
